original: @218b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @218b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: panytsa de wa t'i s'a dha nam autde sha /
analyzed: panytsa de wa t'i s'a dha nam autde sha /
translated: Pañcadevatāsādhanamuddeśa

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: lha mo lnga'i sgrub thabs mdor bstan pa /
analyzed: lha mo lnga'i sgrub thabs mdor bstan pa /
translated: The concise explanation of the sādhana of the five goddesses

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de nas khrus byas pa'i mthar lha mo lnga mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nas khrus byas pa'i mthar lha mo lnga mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: Then, at the end of bathing, the concise explanation of the five goddesses:

original: de la so so 'brang ba chen mo ni sku mdog ser mo zhal gsum pa /
analyzed: de la so so 'brang ba chen mo ni sku mdog ser mo zhal gsum pa /
translated: Among them, Mahāpratisarā is yellow, with three faces,

original: zhal so so la spyan gsum gsum pa /
analyzed: zhal so so la spyan gsum gsum pa /
translated: each face having three eyes,

original: phyag bcu pa'o //
analyzed: phyag bcu pa'o //
translated: and ten arms.

original: nag po dang / dkar po dag ni g-yas dang / cig shos kyi zhal lo //
analyzed: nag po dang / dkar po dag ni g-yas dang / cig shos kyi zhal lo //
translated: The right and left faces are black and white, respectively.

original: g-yas kyi phyag lnga rnams ni go rims bzhin du ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / mda' dang / mchod sbyin dang / phyag thugs kar gnas pa la gdugs rnams so //
analyzed: g-yas kyi phyag lnga rnams ni go rims bzhin du ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / mda' dang / mchod sbyin dang / phyag thugs kar gnas pa la gdugs rnams so //
translated: The five right hands hold a sword, vajra, arrow, giving gesture, and parasol at the heart, respectively.

original: de bzhin drug du g-yon gyi phyag lnga rnams na gzhu dang / rgyal mtshan dang / rin po che'i chun po dang / dgra sta dang / dung rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin drug du g-yon gyi phyag lnga rnams na gzhu dang / rgyal mtshan dang / rin po che'i chun po dang / dgra sta dang / dung rnams so //
translated: Likewise, in the six directions, in the five left hands are a bow, a banner, a jeweled garland, an axe, and a conch.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan kyi dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan kyi dbu rgyan can /
translated: She has a crown of Ratnasambhava.

original: sha 'gag nag po can /
analyzed: sha 'gag nag po can /
translated: She has a black throat.

original: stod g-yogs dmar pos brgyan pa /
analyzed: stod g-yogs dmar pos brgyan pa /
translated: She is adorned with a red upper garment.

original: skyil krung phyed pas 'gying zhing bzhugs pa /
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pas 'gying zhing bzhugs pa /
translated: She stands in half-lotus posture.

original: lha'i rgyan dang / gos thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rgyan dang / gos thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: She is adorned with all the ornaments and garments of a goddess.

original: rma bya chen mo ni sku mdog ljang gu zhal gcig pa /
analyzed: rma bya chen mo ni sku mdog ljang gu zhal gcig pa /
translated: Mahāmāyūrī has a green body, one face,

original: phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa /
translated: and two arms.

original: mdzes shing rma bya'i mdongs dang ldan pa mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya phyag g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag gis so zhes so //
analyzed: mdzes shing rma bya'i mdongs dang ldan pa mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya phyag g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag gis so zhes so //
translated: She is beautiful, with peacock feathers, and with her right and left hands makes the boon-granting and teaching gestures.

original: stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma ni sngon ma ji lta ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma ni sngon ma ji lta ba de bzhin no //
translated: Mahāsāhasrapramardinī is just like before.

original: gsang sngags chen ma rjes su 'dzin ma ni zhal gcig pa /
analyzed: gsang sngags chen ma rjes su 'dzin ma ni zhal gcig pa /
translated: Mahāvidyādharaṇī has one face,

original: phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa /
translated: and four arms.

original: sku mdog nag mo phyag g-yas pa dag gis ral gri dang / mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sku mdog nag mo phyag g-yas pa dag gis ral gri dang / mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: She is black, and with her right hands she holds a sword and makes the boon-granting gesture.

original: phyag g-yon pa dag gis dgra sta dang / zhags pa bsnams pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa dag gis dgra sta dang / zhags pa bsnams pa'o zhes so //
translated: With her left hands she holds an axe and a noose.

original: bsil ba'i tshal chen mo ni sku mdog dmar mo zhal gcig pa phyag bzhi pa phyag g-yas pa dag gis ral gri dang / mchog sbyin //
analyzed: bsil ba'i tshal chen mo ni sku mdog dmar mo zhal gcig pa phyag bzhi pa phyag g-yas pa dag gis ral gri dang / mchog sbyin //
translated: Mahāśītavatī is red, with one face and four arms. With her right hands she holds a sword and makes the boon-granting gesture.

original: @219a * // g-yon pa dag gis dgra sta dang zhags pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: @219a * // g-yon pa dag gis dgra sta dang zhags pa'o zhes so //
translated: With her left hands she holds an axe and a noose.

original: yi ge gsum gyis mtshan cing rang gi sa bon gyi dbus su rang gi ming dang bcas pa ni 'di rnams kyi sngags so //
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyis mtshan cing rang gi sa bon gyi dbus su rang gi ming dang bcas pa ni 'di rnams kyi sngags so //
translated: They are marked with the three syllables and in the middle of their seed syllables are their names. These are their mantras.

original: lha mo lnga'i sgrub thabs mdor bstan pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: lha mo lnga'i sgrub thabs mdor bstan pa rdzogs so//
translated: The concise explanation of the sādhana of the five goddesses is complete.
